column3: Lately, Iâ€™ve just been feeling really down. Iâ€™m tired all the time, even after sleeping for hours. column4: Based on the patient's self-report and the inventory scores, there are strong indications of a Major Depressive Disorder with moderate to severe symptoms. The PHQ-4 score suggests significant levels of both anxiety and depression, while the PHQ-9 and BDI-II scores point towards depressed mood, anhedonia (loss of pleasure), fatigue, insomnia, feelings of worthlessness, and suicidal ideation. It's crucial to have a thorough clinical evaluation to confirm the diagnosis and develop an appropriate treatment plan.
